comments:
The reason I put non-critical in the PR title is because I was doing something bogus.
	But someone should take a look at the walkback anyhow.
	Here's what happened:
		- yesterday, in drop 117, I ran the SWT Example Launcher
		- I used the Example Launcher to add the code for the SWT Paint example to my workspace (the launcher has an "Add to Workspace" button).
		- what that does is basically create a Java project in my workspace and import the example's source code into the new project

		- today - *in the file system* - I deleted the little test "Paint" project from my target workspace's plugins directory
		- then, I upgraded to drop 118, but I always keep the same .metadata and I keep projects I care about in my workspace
		- when I started up eclipse 118, I got the following walkbacks:

NOTES:
	CM (6/4/2001 12:26:35 PM)
		Interestingly, this is causing further problems now - I just got a walkback trying to build.
		The errors are:

CM (6/4/2001 12:29:13 PM)
	Maybe all these file not found errors should be caught and reported in a prettier manner?
	Maybe I was not being too bogus? Is deleting a project in the file system something we
	should maybe expect users to do, so we should handle it better?
